2442  ! calculate the transformation matrix between equilibrium V(mec) and F(lux)
2443  ! oordinate system
2444  integer function calc_t_vf_ind(grid,eq_1,eq_2,deriv) result(ierr)
2445  use num_vars, only: use_pol_flux_f
2446  use num_utilities, only: add_arr_mult, c
2447 
2448  character(*), parameter :: rout_name = 'calc_T_VF_ind'
2449 
2450  ! input / output
2451  type(grid_type), intent(in) :: grid ! grid
2452  type(eq_1_type), intent(in) :: eq_1 ! flux equilibrium
2453  type(eq_2_type), intent(inout) :: eq_2 ! metric equilibrium
2454  integer, intent(in) :: deriv(:)
2455 
2456  ! local variables
2457  integer :: kd ! counter
2458  real(dp), allocatable :: theta_s(:,:,:,:,:,:) ! theta_F and derivatives
2459  real(dp), allocatable :: zeta_s(:,:,:,:,:,:) ! - zeta_F and derivatives
2460  integer :: dims(3) ! dimensions
2461  integer :: c1 ! 2D coordinate in met_type storage convention
2462 
2463  ! initialize ierr
2464  ierr = 0
2465 
2466  ! check the derivatives requested
2467  ierr = check_deriv(deriv,max_deriv,'calc_T_VF')
2468  chckerr('')
2469 
2470  ! set up dims
2471  dims = [grid%n(1),grid%n(2),grid%loc_n_r]
2472 
2473  ! initialize
2474  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = 0._dp
2475 
2476  ! set up theta_s
2477  allocate(theta_s(dims(1),dims(2),dims(3),&
2478  &0:deriv(1)+1,0:deriv(2)+1,0:deriv(3)+1))
2479  theta_s = 0.0_dp
2480  ! start from theta_E
2481  theta_s(:,:,:,0,0,0) = grid%theta_E
2482  theta_s(:,:,:,0,1,0) = 1.0_dp
2483  ! add the deformation described by lambda
2484  theta_s = theta_s + &
2485  &eq_2%L_E(:,:,:,0:deriv(1)+1,0:deriv(2)+1,0:deriv(3)+1)
2486 
2487  if (use_pol_flux_f) then
2488  ! calculate transformation matrix T_V^F
2489  ! (1,1)
2490  ierr = add_arr_mult(theta_s,eq_1%q_saf_E(:,1:),&
2491  &eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,1],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)),&
2492  &deriv)
2493  chckerr('')
2494  ierr = add_arr_mult(eq_2%L_E(:,:,:,1:,0:,0:),eq_1%q_saf_E(:,0:),&
2495  &eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,1],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)),&
2496  &deriv)
2497  chckerr('')
2498  ! (1,2)
2499  if (deriv(2).eq.0 .and. deriv(3).eq.0) then
2500  do kd = 1,dims(3)
2501  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,kd,c([1,2],.false.),deriv(1),0,0) = &
2502  &eq_1%flux_p_E(kd,deriv(1)+1)/(2*pi)
2503  end do
2504  !else
2505  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,2],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) &
2506  !&= 0.0_dp
2507  end if
2508  ! (1,3)
2509  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,3],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2510  &eq_2%L_E(:,:,:,deriv(1)+1,deriv(2),deriv(3))
2511  ! (2,1)
2512  ierr = add_arr_mult(theta_s(:,:,:,0:,1:,0:),eq_1%q_saf_E,&
2513  &eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,1],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)),&
2514  &deriv)
2515  chckerr('')
2516  ! (2,2)
2517  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,2],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2518  !&0.0_dp
2519  ! (2,3)
2520  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,3],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2521  &theta_s(:,:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2)+1,deriv(3))
2522  ! (3,1)
2523  if (sum(deriv).eq.0) then
2524  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,1],.false.),0,0,0) = -1.0_dp
2525  end if
2526  ierr = add_arr_mult(eq_2%L_E(:,:,:,0:,0:,1:),eq_1%q_saf_E,&
2527  &eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,1],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)),&
2528  &deriv)
2529  chckerr('')
2530  ! (3,2)
2531  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,2],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2532  !&0.0_dp
2533  ! (3,3)
2534  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,3],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2535  &eq_2%L_E(:,:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)+1)
2536 
2537  ! determinant
2538  eq_2%det_T_EF(:,:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = 0.0_dp
2539  ierr = add_arr_mult(-theta_s(:,:,:,0:,1:,0:),&
2540  &eq_1%flux_p_E(:,1:)/(2*pi),&
2541  &eq_2%det_T_EF(:,:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)),deriv)
2542  chckerr('')
2543  else
2544  ! set up zeta_s
2545  allocate(zeta_s(dims(1),dims(2),dims(3),0:deriv(1)+1,&
2546  &0:deriv(2)+1,0:deriv(3)+1))
2547  zeta_s = 0.0_dp
2548  ! start from zeta_E
2549  zeta_s(:,:,:,0,0,0) = grid%zeta_E
2550  zeta_s(:,:,:,0,0,1) = 1.0_dp
2551 
2552  ! calculate transformation matrix T_V^F
2553  ! (1,1)
2554  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,1],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2555  &-theta_s(:,:,:,deriv(1)+1,deriv(2),deriv(3))
2556  ierr = add_arr_mult(zeta_s,eq_1%rot_t_E(:,1:),&
2557  &eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,1],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)),&
2558  &deriv)
2559  chckerr('')
2560  ! (1,2)
2561  if (deriv(2).eq.0 .and. deriv(3).eq.0) then
2562  do kd = 1,dims(3)
2563  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,kd,c([1,2],.false.),deriv(1),0,0) = &
2564  &-eq_1%flux_t_E(kd,deriv(1)+1)/(2*pi)
2565  end do
2566  !else
2567  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,2],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) 7
2568  !&= 0.0_dp
2569  end if
2570  ! (1,3)
2571  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,3],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2572  !&0.0_dp
2573  ! (2,1)
2574  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,1],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2575  &-theta_s(:,:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2)+1,deriv(3))
2576  ! (2,2)
2577  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,2],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2578  !&0.0_dp
2579  ! (2,3)
2580  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,3],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2581  !&0.0_dp
2582  ! (3,1)
2583  if (deriv(2).eq.0 .and. deriv(3).eq.0) then
2584  do kd = 1,dims(3)
2585  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,kd,c([3,1],.false.),deriv(1),0,0) = &
2586  &eq_1%rot_t_E(kd,deriv(1))
2587  end do
2588  end if
2589  c1 = c([3,1],.false.) ! to avoid compiler crash (as of 26-02-2015)
2590  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c1,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2591  &eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c1,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) &
2592  &-theta_s(:,:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)+1)
2593  ! (3,2)
2594  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,2],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2595  !&0.0_dp
2596  ! (3,3)
2597  if (sum(deriv).eq.0) then
2598  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,3],.false.),0,0,0) = -1.0_dp
2599  !else
2600  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,3],.false.)deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2601  !&0.0_dp
2602  end if
2603 
2604  ! determinant
2605  eq_2%det_T_EF(:,:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = 0.0_dp
2606  ierr = add_arr_mult(theta_s(:,:,:,0:,1:,0:),&
2607  &eq_1%flux_t_E(:,1:)/(2*pi),&
2608  &eq_2%det_T_EF(:,:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)),deriv)
2609  chckerr('')
2610  end if
2611  end function calc_t_vf_ind
2612  integer function calc_t_vf_arr(grid,eq_1,eq_2,deriv) result(ierr)
2613  character(*), parameter :: rout_name = 'calc_T_VF_arr'
2614 
2615  ! input / output
2616  type(grid_type), intent(in) :: grid ! grid
2617  type(eq_1_type), intent(in) :: eq_1 ! flux equilibrium
2618  type(eq_2_type), intent(inout) :: eq_2 ! metric equilibrium
2619  integer, intent(in) :: deriv(:,:)
2620 
2621  ! local variables
2622  integer :: id
2623

2625  ierr = 0
2626

2629  chckerr('')

2633  ! calculate the transformation matrix between H(ELENA) and F(lux) oordinate
2634  ! system
2635  integer function calc_t_hf_ind(grid,eq_1,eq_2,deriv) result(ierr)
2636  use num_vars, only: use_pol_flux_f
2637  use num_utilities, only: add_arr_mult, c
2638 
2639  character(*), parameter :: rout_name = 'calc_T_HF_ind'
2640 
2641  ! input / output
2642  type(grid_type), intent(in) :: grid ! grid
2643  type(eq_1_type), intent(in) :: eq_1 ! flux equilibrium
2644  type(eq_2_type), intent(inout) :: eq_2 ! metric equilibrium
2645  integer, intent(in) :: deriv(:)
2646 
2647  ! local variables
2648  integer :: kd ! counter
2649  real(dp), allocatable :: theta_s(:,:,:,:,:,:) ! theta_F and derivatives
2650  real(dp), allocatable :: zeta_s(:,:,:,:,:,:) ! - zeta_F and derivatives
2651  integer :: dims(3) ! dimensions
2652 
2653  ! initialize ierr
2654  ierr = 0
2655 
2656  ! check the derivatives requested
2657  ierr = check_deriv(deriv,max_deriv,'calc_T_HF')
2658  chckerr('')
2659 
2660  ! set up dims
2661  dims = [grid%n(1),grid%n(2),grid%loc_n_r]
2662 
2663  ! initialize
2664  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = 0._dp
2665 
2666  ! set up theta_s
2667  allocate(theta_s(dims(1),dims(2),dims(3),&
2668  &0:deriv(1)+1,0:deriv(2)+1,0:deriv(3)+1))
2669  theta_s = 0.0_dp
2670  theta_s(:,:,:,0,0,0) = grid%theta_E
2671  theta_s(:,:,:,0,1,0) = 1.0_dp
2672 
2673  if (use_pol_flux_f) then
2674  ! calculate transformation matrix T_H^F
2675  ! (1,1)
2676  ierr = add_arr_mult(theta_s,-eq_1%q_saf_E(:,1:),&
2677  &eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,1],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)),&
2678  &deriv)
2679  chckerr('')
2680  ! (1,2)
2681  if (sum(deriv).eq.0) then
2682  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,2],.false.),0,0,0) = 1._dp
2683  !else
2684  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,2],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) &
2685  !&= 0.0_dp
2686  end if
2687  ! (1,3)
2688  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,3],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2689  !&0.0_dp
2690  ! (2,1)
2691  if (deriv(2).eq.0 .and. deriv(3).eq.0) then
2692  do kd = 1,dims(3)
2693  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,kd,c([2,1],.false.),deriv(1),0,0) = &
2694  &-eq_1%q_saf_E(kd,deriv(1))
2695  end do
2696  !else
2697  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,1],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) &
2698  !&= 0.0_dp
2699  end if
2700  ! (2,2)
2701  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,2],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2702  !&0.0_dp
2703  ! (2,3)
2704  if (sum(deriv).eq.0) then
2705  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,3],.false.),0,0,0) = 1.0_dp
2706  !else
2707  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,3],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) &
2708  !&= 0.0_dp
2709  end if
2710  ! (3,1)
2711  if (sum(deriv).eq.0) then
2712  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,1],.false.),0,0,0) = 1.0_dp
2713  !else
2714  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,1],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) &
2715  !&= 0.0_dp
2716  end if
2717  ! (3,2)
2718  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,2],.false),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2719  !&0.0_dp
2720  ! (3,3)
2721  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,3],.false),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2722  !&0.0_dp
2723 
2724  ! determinant
2725  eq_2%det_T_EF(:,:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = 0.0_dp
2726  if (sum(deriv).eq.0) then
2727  eq_2%det_T_EF(:,:,:,deriv(1),0,0) = 1._dp
2728  !else
2729  !eq_2%det_T_EF(:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = 0.0_dp
2730  end if
2731  else
2732  ! set up zeta_s
2733  allocate(zeta_s(dims(1),dims(2),dims(3),&
2734  &0:deriv(1)+1,0:deriv(2)+1,0:deriv(3)+1))
2735  zeta_s = 0.0_dp
2736  ! start from zeta_E
2737  zeta_s(:,:,:,0,0,0) = grid%zeta_E
2738  zeta_s(:,:,:,0,0,1) = 1.0_dp
2739 
2740  ! calculate transformation matrix T_H^F
2741  ! (1,1)
2742  ierr = add_arr_mult(zeta_s,eq_1%rot_t_E(:,1:),&
2743  &eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,1],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)),&
2744  &deriv)
2745  chckerr('')
2746  ! (1,2)
2747  if (deriv(2).eq.0 .and. deriv(3).eq.0) then
2748  do kd = 1,dims(3)
2749  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,kd,c([1,2],.false.),deriv(1),0,0) = &
2750  &eq_1%q_saf_E(kd,deriv(1))
2751  end do
2752  !else
2753  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,2],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) &
2754  !&= 0.0_dp
2755  end if
2756  ! (1,3)
2757  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([1,3],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2758  !&0.0_dp
2759  ! (2,1)
2760  if (sum(deriv).eq.0) then
2761  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,1],.false.),0,0,0) = -1.0_dp
2762  !else
2763  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,1],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) &
2764  !&= 0.0_dp
2765  end if
2766  ! (2,2)
2767  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,2],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2768  !&0.0_dp
2769  ! (2,3)
2770  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([2,3],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2771  !&0.0_dp
2772  ! (3,1)
2773  if (deriv(2).eq.0 .and. deriv(3).eq.0) then
2774  do kd = 1,dims(3)
2775  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,kd,c([3,1],.false.),deriv(1),0,0) = &
2776  &eq_1%rot_t_E(kd,deriv(1))
2777  end do
2778  !else
2779  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,1],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) &
2780  !&= 0.0_dp
2781  end if
2782  ! (3,2)
2783  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,2],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = &
2784  !&0.0_dp
2785  ! (3,3)
2786  if (sum(deriv).eq.0) then
2787  eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,3],.false.),deriv(1),0,0) = 1.0_dp
2788  !else
2789  !eq_2%T_EF(:,:,:,c([3,3],.false.),deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) &
2790  !&= 0.0_dp
2791  end if
2792 
2793  ! determinant
2794  eq_2%det_T_EF(:,:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = 0.0_dp
2795  if (deriv(2).eq.0 .and. deriv(3).eq.0) then
2796  do kd = 1,dims(3)
2797  eq_2%det_T_EF(:,:,kd,deriv(1),0,0) = &
2798  &eq_1%q_saf_E(kd,deriv(1))
2799  end do
2800  !else
2801  !eq_2%det_T_EF(:,:,deriv(1),deriv(2),deriv(3)) = 0.0_dp
2802  end if
2803  end if
2804  end function calc_t_hf_ind
2805  integer function calc_t_hf_arr(grid,eq_1,eq_2,deriv) result(ierr)
2806  character(*), parameter :: rout_name = 'calc_T_HF_arr'
2807 
2808  ! input / output
2809  type(grid_type), intent(in) :: grid ! grid
2810  type(eq_1_type), intent(in) :: eq_1 ! flux equilibrium
2811  type(eq_2_type), intent(inout) :: eq_2 ! metric equilibrium
2812  integer, intent(in) :: deriv(:,:)
2813 
2814  ! local variables
2815  integer :: id
2816 
2817  ! initialize ierr
2818  ierr = 0
2819 
2820  do id = 1, size(deriv,2)
2821  ierr = calc_t_hf_ind(grid,eq_1,eq_2,deriv(:,id))
2822  chckerr('')
2823  end do
2824  end function calc_t_hf_arr
2825 
2826  ! Calculates derived equilibrium quantities
2827  ! system [ADD REF]:
2828  ! - magnetic shear S
2829  ! - normal curvature kappa_n
2830  ! - geodesic curvature kappa_g
2831  ! - parallel current sigma
2832  subroutine calc_derived_q(grid_eq,eq_1,eq_2)
2833  use num_utilities, only: c
2834  use eq_vars, only: vac_perm
2835  use splines, only: spline3
2836 #if ldebug
2837  use num_vars, only: use_pol_flux_f
2838  use num_utilities, only: calc_int
2839 #endif
2840 
2841  ! input / output
2842  type(grid_type), intent(in) :: grid_eq ! equilibrium grid
2843  type(eq_1_type), intent(in) :: eq_1 ! flux equilibrium variables
2844  type(eq_2_type), intent(inout), target :: eq_2 ! metric equilibrium variables
2845 
2846  ! local variables
2847  integer :: kd ! counter
2848  ! submatrices
2849  ! jacobian
2850  real(dp), pointer :: J(:,:,:) => null() ! jac
2851  real(dp), pointer :: D1J(:,:,:) => null() ! D_alpha jac
2852  real(dp), pointer :: D2J(:,:,:) => null() ! D_psi jac
2853  real(dp), pointer :: D3J(:,:,:) => null() ! D_theta jac
2854  ! lower metric factors
2855  real(dp), pointer :: g13(:,:,:) => null() ! g_alpha,theta
2856  real(dp), pointer :: D2g13(:,:,:) => null() ! D_psi g_alpha,theta
2857  real(dp), pointer :: D3g13(:,:,:) => null() ! D_theta g_alpha,theta
2858  real(dp), pointer :: g23(:,:,:) => null() ! g_psi,theta
2859  real(dp), pointer :: D1g23(:,:,:) => null() ! D_alpha g_psi,theta
2860  real(dp), pointer :: D3g23(:,:,:) => null() ! D_theta g_psi,theta
2861  real(dp), pointer :: g33(:,:,:) => null() ! g_theta,theta
2862  real(dp), pointer :: D1g33(:,:,:) => null() ! D_alpha g_theta,theta
2863  real(dp), pointer :: D2g33(:,:,:) => null() ! D_psi g_theta,theta
2864  real(dp), pointer :: D3g33(:,:,:) => null() ! D_theta g_theta,theta
2865  ! upper metric factors
2866  real(dp), pointer :: h12(:,:,:) => null() ! h^alpha,psi
2867  real(dp), pointer :: D3h12(:,:,:) => null() ! D_theta h^alpha,psi
2868  real(dp), pointer :: h22(:,:,:) => null() ! h^psi,psi
2869  real(dp), pointer :: D3h22(:,:,:) => null() ! D_theta h^psi,psi
2870  real(dp), pointer :: h23(:,:,:) => null() ! h^psi,theta
2871 #if ldebug
2872  real(dp), pointer :: D13J(:,:,:) => null() ! D_alpha,theta jac
2873  real(dp), pointer :: D23J(:,:,:) => null() ! D_psi,theta jac
2874  real(dp), pointer :: D23g13(:,:,:) => null() ! D_psi,theta g_alpha,theta
2875  real(dp), pointer :: D13g23(:,:,:) => null() ! D_alpha,theta g_psi,theta
2876  real(dp), allocatable :: D3sigma(:,:,:) ! D_theta sigma
2877  real(dp), allocatable :: D3sigma_ALT(:,:,:) ! alternative D_theta sigma
2878  real(dp), allocatable :: sigma_ALT(:,:,:) ! alternative sigma
2879  real(dp), pointer :: ang_par_F(:,:,:) => null() ! parallel angle theta_F or zeta_F
2880  integer :: istat ! status
2881  integer :: jd ! counter
2882 #endif
2883 
2884  ! user output
2885  call writo('Set up derived quantities in flux coordinates')
2886 
2887  call lvl_ud(1)
2888 
2889  ! set up submatrices
2890  ! jacobian
2891  j => eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,0,0)
2892  d1j => eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,1,0,0)
2893  d2j => eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,1,0)
2894  d3j => eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,0,1)
2895  ! lower metric factors
2896  g13 => eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([1,3],.true.),0,0,0)
2897  d2g13 => eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([1,3],.true.),0,1,0)
2898  d3g13 => eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([1,3],.true.),0,0,1)
2899  g23 => eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([2,3],.true.),0,0,0)
2900  d1g23 => eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([2,3],.true.),1,0,0)
2901  d3g23 => eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([2,3],.true.),0,0,1)
2902  g33 => eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([3,3],.true.),0,0,0)
2903  d1g33 => eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([3,3],.true.),1,0,0)
2904  d2g33 => eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([3,3],.true.),0,1,0)
2905  d3g33 => eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([3,3],.true.),0,0,1)
2906  ! upper metric factors
2907  h12 => eq_2%h_FD(:,:,:,c([1,2],.true.),0,0,0)
2908  d3h12 => eq_2%h_FD(:,:,:,c([1,2],.true.),0,0,1)
2909  h22 => eq_2%h_FD(:,:,:,c([2,2],.true.),0,0,0)
2910  d3h22 => eq_2%h_FD(:,:,:,c([2,2],.true.),0,0,1)
2911  h23 => eq_2%h_FD(:,:,:,c([2,3],.true.),0,0,0)
2912 #if ldebug
2913  d13j => eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,1,0,1)
2914  d23j => eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,1,1)
2915  d23g13 => eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([1,3],.true.),0,1,1)
2916  d13g23 => eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([2,3],.true.),1,0,1)
2917 #endif
2918 
2919  ! Calculate the shear S
2920  eq_2%S = -(d3h12/h22 - d3h22*h12/h22**2)/j
2921 
2922  ! Calculate the normal curvature kappa_n
2923  do kd = 1,grid_eq%loc_n_r
2924  eq_2%kappa_n(:,:,kd) = &
2925  &vac_perm*j(:,:,kd)**2*eq_1%pres_FD(kd,1)/g33(:,:,kd) + &
2926  &1._dp/(2*h22(:,:,kd)) * ( &
2927  &h12(:,:,kd) * ( d1g33(:,:,kd)/g33(:,:,kd) - &
2928  &2*d1j(:,:,kd)/j(:,:,kd) ) + &
2929  &h22(:,:,kd) * ( d2g33(:,:,kd)/g33(:,:,kd) - &
2930  &2*d2j(:,:,kd)/j(:,:,kd) ) + &
2931  &h23(:,:,kd) * ( d3g33(:,:,kd)/g33(:,:,kd) - &
2932  &2*d3j(:,:,kd)/j(:,:,kd) ) )
2933  end do
2934 
2935  ! Calculate the geodesic curvature kappa_g
2936  eq_2%kappa_g(:,:,:) = (0.5*d1g33/g33 - d1j/j) - &
2937  &g13/g33*(0.5*d3g33/g33 - d3j/j)
2938 
2939  ! Calculate the parallel current sigma
2940  eq_2%sigma = 1._dp/vac_perm*&
2941  &(d1g23 - d2g13 - (g23*d1j - g13*d2j)/j)/j
2942  do kd = 1,grid_eq%loc_n_r
2943  eq_2%sigma(:,:,kd) = eq_2%sigma(:,:,kd) - &
2944  &eq_1%pres_FD(kd,1)*j(:,:,kd)*g13(:,:,kd)/g33(:,:,kd)
2945  end do
2946 
2947 #if ldebug
2948  ! test whether -2 p' J kappa_g = D3sigma and plot kappa components
2949  if (debug_calc_derived_q) then
2950  call writo('Testing whether -2 p'' J kappa_g = D3sigma')
2951  call lvl_ud(1)
2952 
2953  ! allocate variables
2954  allocate(d3sigma(grid_eq%n(1),grid_eq%n(2),grid_eq%loc_n_r))
2955  allocate(d3sigma_alt(grid_eq%n(1),grid_eq%n(2),grid_eq%loc_n_r))
2956  allocate(sigma_alt(grid_eq%n(1),grid_eq%n(2),grid_eq%loc_n_r))
2957 
2958  ! point parallel angle
2959  if (use_pol_flux_f) then
2960  ang_par_f => grid_eq%theta_F
2961  else
2962  ang_par_f => grid_eq%zeta_F
2963  end if
2964 
2965  ! get derived sigma
2966  do kd = 1,grid_eq%loc_n_r
2967  do jd = 1,grid_eq%n(2)
2968  istat = spline3(ang_par_f(:,jd,kd),eq_2%sigma(:,jd,kd),&
2969  &ang_par_f(:,jd,kd),dynew=d3sigma(:,jd,kd))
2970  chckstt
2971  end do
2972  end do
2973  !!D3sigma_ALT = -1._dp/vac_perm*&
2974  !!&(D1g23 - D2g13 - (g23*D1J - g13*D2J)/J)/J**2*D3J + &
2975  !!&1._dp/vac_perm*&
2976  !!&(D13g23 - D23g13 - (D3g23*D1J + g23*D13J - &
2977  !!&D3g13*D2J - g13*D23J)/J + (g23*D1J - g13*D2J)/J**2*D3J)/J
2978  !!do kd = 1,grid_eq%loc_n_r
2979  !!D3sigma_ALT(:,:,kd) = D3sigma_ALT(:,:,kd) - &
2980  !!&eq_1%pres_FD(kd,1)*(D3J(:,:,kd)*g13(:,:,kd)/g33(:,:,kd) + &
2981  !!&J(:,:,kd)*D3g13(:,:,kd)/g33(:,:,kd) - &
2982  !!&J(:,:,kd)*g13(:,:,kd)/g33(:,:,kd)**2*D3g33(:,:,kd))
2983  !!end do
2984 
2985  ! calculate alternatively derived sigma
2986  do kd = 1,grid_eq%loc_n_r
2987  d3sigma_alt(:,:,kd) = &
2988  &-2*eq_1%pres_FD(kd,1)*eq_2%kappa_g(:,:,kd)*j(:,:,kd)
2989  end do
2990 
2991  ! calculate alternative sigma by integration
2992  ! Note: there is an undetermined constant of integration that
2993  ! depends on the normal coordinate and the geodesic coordinate.
2994  do kd = 1,grid_eq%loc_n_r
2995  do jd = 1,grid_eq%n(2)
2996  istat = calc_int(d3sigma_alt(:,jd,kd),ang_par_f(:,jd,kd),&
2997  &sigma_alt(:,jd,kd))
2998  chckstt
2999  end do
3000  sigma_alt(:,:,kd) = eq_2%sigma(1,1,kd) + sigma_alt(:,:,kd)
3001  end do
3002 
3003  ! plot output
3004  call plot_diff_hdf5(d3sigma,d3sigma_alt,'TEST_D3sigma',&
3005  &grid_eq%n,[0,0,grid_eq%i_min-1],&
3006  &description='To test whether -2 p'' J kappa_g = D3sigma',&
3007  &output_message=.true.)
3008  call plot_diff_hdf5(eq_2%sigma,sigma_alt,'TEST_sigma',grid_eq%n,&
3009  &[0,0,grid_eq%i_min-1],description='To test whether &
3010  &int(-2 p'' J kappa_g) = sigma',output_message=.true.)
3011 
3012  ! plot shear
3013  call plot_hdf5('shear','TEST_shear',eq_2%S,&
3014  &tot_dim=grid_eq%n,loc_offset=[0,0,grid_eq%i_min-1])
3015 
3016  ! plot kappa_n
3017  call plot_hdf5('kappa_n','TEST_kappa_n',eq_2%kappa_n,&
3018  &tot_dim=grid_eq%n,loc_offset=[0,0,grid_eq%i_min-1])
3019 
3020  ! plot kappa_g
3021  call plot_hdf5('kappa_g','TEST_kappa_g',eq_2%kappa_g,&
3022  &tot_dim=grid_eq%n,loc_offset=[0,0,grid_eq%i_min-1])
3023 
3024  ! clean up
3025  nullify(ang_par_f)
3026 
3027  call lvl_ud(-1)
3028  call writo('Testing done')
3029  end if
3030 #endif
3031 
3032  ! clean up
3033  nullify(j,d1j,d2j,d3j)
3034  nullify(g13,d2g13,d3g13)
3035  nullify(g23,d1g23,d3g23)
3036  nullify(g33,d1g33,d2g33,d3g33)
3037  nullify(h12,d3h12)
3038  nullify(h22,d3h22)
3039  nullify(h23)
3040 
3041  call lvl_ud(-1)
3042  end subroutine calc_derived_q
3043 
3044  ! Sets up normalization constants.
3045  subroutine calc_normalization_const()
3046  use num_vars, only: rank, eq_style, mu_0_original, use_normalization, &
3047  &rich_restart_lvl
3048  use eq_vars, only: t_0, b_0, pres_0, psi_0, r_0, rho_0
3049 
3050  ! local variables
3051  integer :: nr_overriden_const ! nr. of user-overriden constants, to print warning if > 0
3052 
3053  if (use_normalization) then
3054  ! user output
3055  call writo('Calculating the normalization constants')
3056  call lvl_ud(1)
3057 
3058  ! initialize nr_overriden_const
3059  nr_overriden_const = 0
3060 
3061  ! calculation
3062  if (rank.eq.0) then
3063  ! choose which equilibrium style is being used:
3064  ! 1: VMEC
3065  ! 2: HELENA
3066  select case (eq_style)
3067  case (1) ! VMEC
3068  call calc_normalization_const_vmec
3069  case (2) ! HELENA
3070  call calc_normalization_const_hel
3071  end select
3072  end if
3073 
3074  ! print warning if user-overriden
3075  if (nr_overriden_const.gt.0) &
3076  &call writo(trim(i2str(nr_overriden_const))//&
3077  &' constants were overriden by user. Consistency is NOT &
3078  &checked!',warning=.true.)
3079 
3080  ! print constants
3081  call print_normalization_const(r_0,rho_0,b_0,pres_0,psi_0,&
3082  &mu_0_original,t_0)
3083 
3084  ! user output
3085  call lvl_ud(-1)
3086  call writo('Normalization constants calculated')
3087  else if (rich_restart_lvl.eq.1) then ! only for first Richardson leevel
3088  ! user output
3089  call writo('Normalization not used')
3090  end if
3091  contains
3092  ! VMEC version
3093  ! Normalization depends on style:
3094  ! 1: MISHKA
3095  ! R_0: major radius (= average magnetic axis)
3096  ! B_0: B on magnetic axis (theta = zeta = 0)
3097  ! pres_0: reference pressure (= B_0^2/mu_0)
3098  ! psi_0: reference flux (= R_0^2 B_0)
3099  ! rho_0: reference mass density
3100  ! 2: COBRA
3101  ! R_0: major radius (= average geometric axis)
3102  ! pres_0: pressure on magnetic axis
3103  ! B_0: reference magnetic field (= sqrt(2pres_0mu_0 / beta))
3104  ! psi_0: reference flux (= R_0^2 B_0 / aspr^2)
3105  ! rho_0: reference mass density
3106  ! where aspr (aspect ratio) and beta are given by VMEC.
3107  ! Note that rho_0 is not given through by the equilibrium codes and
3108  ! should be user-supplied
3109  subroutine calc_normalization_const_vmec
3110  use num_vars, only: norm_style
3111  use vmec_vars, only: r_v_c, b_0_v, rmax_surf, rmin_surf, pres_v, &
3112  &beta_v
3113  !use VMEC_vars, only: aspr_V
3114 
3115  select case (norm_style)
3116  ! Note that PB3D does not run with the exact COBRA normalization
3117  ! (for style 2), as it is not a pure nondimensionalization, that
3118  ! would modify the equations by intrucing extra factors. The
3119  ! diffference between the COBRA normalization used here and the
3120  ! one used in COBRA is given by:
3121  ! - B_0 = sqrt(pres_0 mu_0) here
3122  ! versus
3123  ! B_0 = sqrt(2 pres_0 mu_0 / beta) in COBRA,
3124  ! - psi_0 = B_0 R_0^2 here
3125  ! versus
3126  ! psi_0 = B_0 (R_0/aspr)^2 in COBRA,
3127  ! This results in a difference in the factor T_0:
3128  ! - T_0 = sqrt(rho_0/pres_0) R_0 here
3129  ! versus
3130  ! T_0 = sqrt(rho_0/pres_0) R_0 sqrt(beta/2) in COBRA.
3131  ! Therefore, the Eigenvalues here should be rescaled as
3132  ! - EV_COBRA = EV_PB3D beta/2. This is done automatically.
3133  case (1) ! MISHKA
3134  ! user output
3135  call writo('Using MISHKA normalization')
3136 
3137  ! set the major radius as the average value of R_V on the
3138  ! magnetic axis
3139  if (r_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) then ! user did not provide a value
3140  r_0 = r_v_c(1,1,0)
3141  else
3142  nr_overriden_const = nr_overriden_const + 1
3143  end if
3144 
3145  ! set B_0 from magnetic field on axis
3146  if (b_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) then ! user did not provide a value
3147  b_0 = b_0_v
3148  else
3149  nr_overriden_const = nr_overriden_const + 1
3150  end if
3151 
3152  ! set reference pres_0 from B_0
3153  if (pres_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) then ! user did not provide a value
3154  pres_0 = b_0**2/mu_0_original
3155  else
3156  nr_overriden_const = nr_overriden_const + 1
3157  end if
3158 
3159  ! set reference flux from R_0 and B_0
3160  if (psi_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) then ! user did not provide a value
3161  psi_0 = r_0**2 * b_0
3162  else
3163  nr_overriden_const = nr_overriden_const + 1
3164  end if
3165  case (2) ! COBRA
3166  ! user output
3167  call writo('Using COBRA normalization')
3168 
3169  ! set the major radius as the average geometric axis
3170  if (r_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) then ! user did not provide a value
3171  r_0 = 0.5_dp*(rmin_surf+rmax_surf)
3172  else
3173  nr_overriden_const = nr_overriden_const + 1
3174  end if
3175 
3176  ! set pres_0 from pressure on axis
3177  if (pres_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) then ! user did not provide a value
3178  pres_0 = pres_v(1,0)
3179  else
3180  nr_overriden_const = nr_overriden_const + 1
3181  end if
3182 
3183  ! set the reference value for B_0 from pres_0 and beta
3184  if (b_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) then ! user did not provide a value
3185  !B_0 = sqrt(2._dp*pres_0*mu_0_original/beta_V) ! exact COBRA
3186  b_0 = sqrt(pres_0*mu_0_original) ! pure modified COBRA
3187  else
3188  nr_overriden_const = nr_overriden_const + 1
3189  end if
3190 
3191  ! set reference flux from R_0, B_0 and aspr
3192  if (psi_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) then ! user did not provide a value
3193  !psi_0 = B_0 * (R_0/aspr_V)**2 ! exact COBRA
3194  psi_0 = b_0 * r_0**2 ! pure modified COBRA
3195  else
3196  nr_overriden_const = nr_overriden_const + 1
3197  end if
3198 
3199  ! user output concerning pure modified COBRA
3200  call writo('Exact COBRA normalization is substituted by &
3201  &"pure", modified version',warning=.true.)
3202  call writo('This leaves the equations unmodified',&
3203  &alert=.true.)
3204  call writo('To translate to exact COBRA, manually multiply &
3205  &PB3D Eigenvalues by',alert=.true.)
3206  call lvl_ud(1)
3207  call writo(trim(r2str(beta_v/2)),alert=.true.)
3208  call lvl_ud(-1)
3209  end select
3210 
3211  ! rho_0 is set up through an input variable with the same name
3212 
3213  ! set Alfven time
3214  if (t_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) then ! user did not provide a value
3215  t_0 = sqrt(mu_0_original*rho_0)*r_0/b_0
3216  else
3217  nr_overriden_const = nr_overriden_const + 1
3218  end if
3219  end subroutine calc_normalization_const_vmec
3220 
3221  ! HELENA version
3222  ! The MISHKA normalization is taken by default, see "read_VMEC" for more
3223  ! information.
3224  subroutine calc_normalization_const_hel
3225  ! user output
3226  call writo('Using MISHKA normalization')
3227 
3228  if (r_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) then ! user did not provide a value
3229  r_0 = 1._dp
3230  end if
3231  if (b_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) then ! user did not provide a value
3232  b_0 = 1._dp
3233  end if
3234  if (pres_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) then ! user did not provide a value
3235  pres_0 = b_0**2/mu_0_original
3236  else
3237  nr_overriden_const = nr_overriden_const + 1
3238  end if
3239  if (psi_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) then ! user did not provide a value
3240  psi_0 = r_0**2 * b_0
3241  else
3242  nr_overriden_const = nr_overriden_const + 1
3243  end if
3244  if (t_0.ge.huge(1._dp)) t_0 = sqrt(mu_0_original*rho_0)*r_0/b_0 ! only if user did not provide a value
3245  end subroutine calc_normalization_const_hel
3246 
3247  ! prints the Normalization factors
3248  subroutine print_normalization_const(R_0,rho_0,B_0,pres_0,psi_0,&
3249  &mu_0,T_0)
3250  ! input / output
3251  real(dp), intent(in), optional :: R_0
3252  real(dp), intent(in), optional :: rho_0
3253  real(dp), intent(in), optional :: B_0
3254  real(dp), intent(in), optional :: pres_0
3255  real(dp), intent(in), optional :: psi_0
3256  real(dp), intent(in), optional :: mu_0
3257  real(dp), intent(in), optional :: T_0
3258 
3259  ! user output
3260  if (present(r_0)) call writo('R_0 = '//trim(r2str(r_0))//' m')
3261  if (present(rho_0)) call writo('rho_0 = '//trim(r2str(rho_0))//&
3262  &' kg/m^3')
3263  if (present(b_0)) call writo('B_0 = '//trim(r2str(b_0))//' T')
3264  if (present(pres_0)) call writo('pres_0 = '//trim(r2str(pres_0))//&
3265  &' Pa')
3266  if (present(psi_0)) call writo('psi_0 = '//trim(r2str(psi_0))//&
3267  &' Tm^2')
3268  if (present(mu_0)) call writo('mu_0 = '//&
3269  &trim(r2str(mu_0))//' Tm/A')
3270  if (present(t_0)) call writo('T_0 = '//trim(r2str(t_0))//' s')
3271  end subroutine print_normalization_const
3272  end subroutine calc_normalization_const
3273 
3274  ! Normalize input quantities.
3275  subroutine normalize_input()
3276  use num_vars, only: use_normalization, eq_style, mu_0_original
3277  use vmec_ops, only: normalize_vmec
3278  use eq_vars, only: vac_perm
3279 
3280  ! only normalize if needed
3281  if (use_normalization) then
3282  ! user output
3283  call writo('Start normalizing the input variables')
3284  call lvl_ud(1)
3285 
3286  ! normalize common variables
3287  vac_perm = vac_perm/mu_0_original
3288 
3289  ! choose which equilibrium style is being used:
3290  ! 1: VMEC
3291  ! 2: HELENA
3292  select case (eq_style)
3293  case (1) ! VMEC
3294  call normalize_vmec
3295  case (2) ! HELENA
3296  ! other HELENA input already normalized
3297  call writo('HELENA input is already normalized with MISHKA &
3298  &normalization')
3299  end select
3300 
3301  ! user output
3302  call lvl_ud(-1)
3303  call writo('Normalization done')
3304  end if
3305  end subroutine normalize_input
3306 
3307  ! Plots the magnetic fields. If multiple equilibrium parallel jobs, every
3308  ! job does its piece, and the results are joined automatically by plot_HDF5.
3309  ! The outputs are given in contra- and covariant components and magnitude in
3310  ! multiple coordinate systems, as indicated in "calc_vec_comp".
3311  ! The starting point is the fact that the magnetic field is given by
3312  ! B = e_theta/J
3313  ! in F coordinates. The F covariant components are therefore given by
3314  ! B_i = g_i3/J
3315  ! and the only non-vanishing contravariant component is
3316  ! B^3 = 1/J.
3317  ! These are then all be transformed to the other coordinate systems.
3318  ! Note that vector plots for different Richardson levels can be combined to
3319  ! show the total grid by just plotting them all individually.
3320  ! Note: The metric factors and transformation matrices have to be allocated.
3321  integer function b_plot(grid_eq,eq_1,eq_2,rich_lvl,plot_fluxes) result(ierr)
3322  use grid_utilities, only: calc_vec_comp
3323  use eq_utilities, only: calc_inv_met
3324  use num_vars, only: eq_style, norm_disc_prec_eq, use_normalization
3325  use num_utilities, only: c
3326  use eq_vars, only: b_0
3327  use vmec_utilities, only: calc_trigon_factors
3328 
3329  character(*), parameter :: rout_name = 'B_plot'
3330 
3331  ! input / output
3332  type(grid_type), intent(inout) :: grid_eq ! equilibrium grid
3333  type(eq_1_type), intent(in) :: eq_1 ! flux equilibrium variables
3334  type(eq_2_type), intent(in) :: eq_2 ! metric equilibrium variables
3335  integer, intent(in), optional :: rich_lvl ! Richardson level
3336  logical, intent(in), optional :: plot_fluxes ! plot the fluxes
3337 
3338  ! local variables
3339  integer :: id ! counter
3340  real(dp), allocatable :: B_com(:,:,:,:,:) ! covariant and contravariant components of B (dim1,dim2,dim3,3,2)
3341  real(dp), allocatable :: B_mag(:,:,:) ! magnitude of B (dim1,dim2,dim3)
3342  real(dp), allocatable, save :: B_flux_tor(:,:), B_flux_pol(:,:) ! fluxes
3343  character(len=10) :: base_name ! base name
3344  logical :: plot_fluxes_loc ! local plot_fluxes
3345 
3346  ! initialize ierr
3347  ierr = 0
3348 
3349  ! tests
3350  if (eq_style.eq.1 .and. .not.allocated(grid_eq%trigon_factors)) then
3351  ierr = 1
3352  chckerr('trigonometric factors not allocated')
3353  end if
3354 
3355  ! set up local plot_fluxes
3356  plot_fluxes_loc = .false.
3357  if (present(plot_fluxes)) plot_fluxes_loc = plot_fluxes
3358 
3359  ! set up components and magnitude of B
3360  allocate(b_com(grid_eq%n(1),grid_eq%n(2),grid_eq%loc_n_r,3,2))
3361  allocate(b_mag(grid_eq%n(1),grid_eq%n(2),grid_eq%loc_n_r))
3362  b_com = 0._dp
3363  b_mag = 0._dp
3364  do id = 1,3
3365  b_com(:,:,:,id,1) = eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([3,id],.true.),0,0,0)/&
3366  &eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,0,0)
3367  end do
3368  b_com(:,:,:,3,2) = 1._dp/eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,0,0)
3369 
3370  ! transform back to unnormalized quantity
3371  if (use_normalization) b_com = b_com * b_0
3372 
3373  ! set plot variables
3374  base_name = 'B'
3375  if (present(rich_lvl)) then
3376  if (rich_lvl.gt.0) base_name = trim(base_name)//'_R_'//&
3377  &trim(i2str(rich_lvl))
3378  end if
3379 
3380  ! transform coordinates, including the flux
3381  if (plot_fluxes_loc) then
3382  ierr = calc_vec_comp(grid_eq,grid_eq,eq_1,eq_2,b_com,&
3383  &norm_disc_prec_eq,v_mag=b_mag,base_name=base_name,&
3384  &v_flux_tor=b_flux_tor,v_flux_pol=b_flux_pol)
3385  chckerr('')
3386  else
3387  ierr = calc_vec_comp(grid_eq,grid_eq,eq_1,eq_2,b_com,&
3388  &norm_disc_prec_eq,v_mag=b_mag,base_name=base_name)
3389  chckerr('')
3390  end if
3391  end function b_plot
3392 
3393  ! Plots the current. If multiple equilibrium parallel jobs, every job does
3394  ! its piece, and the results are joined automatically by plot_HDF5. The
3395  ! outputs are given in contra- and covariant components and magnitude in
3396  ! multiple coordinate systems, as indicated in "calc_vec_comp".
3397  ! The starting point is the pressure balance
3398  ! nabla p = J x B,
3399  ! which, using B = e_theta/J, reduces to
3400  ! J^alpha = -p'.
3401  ! Furthermore, the current has to lie in the magnetic flux surfaces:
3402  ! J^psi = 0.
3403  ! Finally, the parallel current sigma gives an expression for the last
3404  ! contravariant component:
3405  ! J^theta = sigma/J + p' B_alpha/B_theta.
3406  ! From these, the contravariant components can be calculated as
3407  ! J_i = J^alpha g_alpha,i + J^theta g_theta,i.
3408  ! These are then all be transformed to the other coordinate systems.
3409  ! Note that vector plots for different Richardson levels can be combined to
3410  ! show the total grid by just plotting them all individually.
3411  ! Note: The metric factors and transformation matrices have to be allocated.
3412  integer function j_plot(grid_eq,eq_1,eq_2,rich_lvl,plot_fluxes) result(ierr)
3413  use grid_utilities, only: calc_vec_comp
3414  use eq_utilities, only: calc_inv_met
3415  use num_vars, only: eq_style, norm_disc_prec_eq, use_normalization
3416  use num_utilities, only: c
3417  use eq_vars, only: b_0, r_0, pres_0
3418  use vmec_utilities, only: calc_trigon_factors
3419 
3420  character(*), parameter :: rout_name = 'J_plot'
3421 
3422  ! input / output
3423  type(grid_type), intent(inout) :: grid_eq ! equilibrium grid
3424  type(eq_1_type), intent(in) :: eq_1 ! flux equilibrium variables
3425  type(eq_2_type), intent(in) :: eq_2 ! metric equilibrium variables
3426  integer, intent(in), optional :: rich_lvl ! Richardson level
3427  logical, intent(in), optional :: plot_fluxes ! plot the fluxes
3428 
3429  ! local variables
3430  integer :: id, kd ! counters
3431  real(dp), allocatable :: J_com(:,:,:,:,:) ! covariant and contravariant components of J (dim1,dim2,dim3,3,2)
3432  real(dp), allocatable :: J_mag(:,:,:) ! magnitude of J (dim1,dim2,dim3)
3433  character(len=10) :: base_name ! base name
3434  real(dp), allocatable, save :: J_flux_tor(:,:), J_flux_pol(:,:) ! fluxes
3435  logical :: plot_fluxes_loc ! local plot_fluxes
3436 
3437  ! initialize ierr
3438  ierr = 0
3439 
3440  ! tests
3441  if (eq_style.eq.1 .and. .not.allocated(grid_eq%trigon_factors)) then
3442  ierr = 1
3443  chckerr('trigonometric factors not allocated')
3444  end if
3445 
3446  ! set up local plot_fluxes
3447  plot_fluxes_loc = .false.
3448  if (present(plot_fluxes)) plot_fluxes_loc = plot_fluxes
3449 
3450  ! set up components and magnitude of J
3451  allocate(j_com(grid_eq%n(1),grid_eq%n(2),grid_eq%loc_n_r,3,2))
3452  allocate(j_mag(grid_eq%n(1),grid_eq%n(2),grid_eq%loc_n_r))
3453  j_com = 0._dp
3454  j_mag = 0._dp
3455 #if ldebug
3456  if (debug_j_plot) then
3457  j_com(:,:,:,1,2) = eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([3,3],.true.),0,1,0) - &
3458  &eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([3,3],.true.),0,0,0)*&
3459  &eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,1,0)/&
3460  &eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,0,0) - &
3461  &eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([2,3],.true.),0,0,1) + &
3462  &eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([2,3],.true.),0,0,0)*&
3463  &eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,0,1)/&
3464  &eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,0,0)
3465  j_com(:,:,:,1,2) = j_com(:,:,:,1,2)/eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,0,0)**2
3466  j_com(:,:,:,3,2) = eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([2,3],.true.),1,0,0) - &
3467  &eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([2,3],.true.),0,0,0)*&
3468  &eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,1,0,0)/&
3469  &eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,0,0) - &
3470  &eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([1,3],.true.),0,1,0) + &
3471  &eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([1,3],.true.),0,0,0)*&
3472  &eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,1,0)/&
3473  &eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,0,0)
3474  j_com(:,:,:,3,2) = j_com(:,:,:,3,2)/eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,0,0)**2
3475  else
3476 #endif
3477  do kd = 1,grid_eq%loc_n_r
3478  j_com(:,:,kd,1,2) = -eq_1%pres_FD(kd,1)
3479  j_com(:,:,kd,3,2) = eq_2%sigma(:,:,kd)/&
3480  &eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,kd,0,0,0) + eq_1%pres_FD(kd,1)*&
3481  &eq_2%g_FD(:,:,kd,c([1,3],.true.),0,0,0) / &
3482  &eq_2%g_FD(:,:,kd,c([3,3],.true.),0,0,0)
3483  end do
3484 #if ldebug
3485  end if
3486 #endif
3487  do id = 1,3
3488  j_com(:,:,:,id,1) = &
3489  &j_com(:,:,:,1,2)*eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([1,id],.true.),0,0,0) + &
3490  &j_com(:,:,:,3,2)*eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([3,id],.true.),0,0,0)
3491  end do
3492 
3493  ! transform back to unnormalized quantity
3494  if (use_normalization) j_com = j_com * pres_0/(r_0*b_0)
3495 
3496  ! set plot variables
3497  base_name = 'J'
3498  if (present(rich_lvl)) then
3499  if (rich_lvl.gt.0) base_name = trim(base_name)//'_R_'//&
3500  &trim(i2str(rich_lvl))
3501  end if
3502 
3503  ! transform coordinates, including the flux
3504  if (plot_fluxes_loc) then
3505  ierr = calc_vec_comp(grid_eq,grid_eq,eq_1,eq_2,j_com,&
3506  &norm_disc_prec_eq,v_mag=j_mag,base_name=base_name,&
3507  &v_flux_tor=j_flux_tor,v_flux_pol=j_flux_pol)
3508  chckerr('')
3509  else
3510  ierr = calc_vec_comp(grid_eq,grid_eq,eq_1,eq_2,j_com,&
3511  &norm_disc_prec_eq,v_mag=j_mag,base_name=base_name)
3512  chckerr('')
3513  end if
3514  end function j_plot
3515 
3516  ! Plots the curvature. If multiple equilibrium parallel jobs, every job does
3517  ! its piece, and the results are joined automatically by plot_HDF5. The
3518  ! outputs are given in contra- and covariant components and magnitude in
3519  ! multiple coordinate systems, as indicated in "calc_vec_comp".
3520  ! The starting point is the curvature, given by
3521  ! kappa = kappa_n nabla psi / |nabla psi|^2 + kappa_g nabla psi x B / B^2
3522  ! which can be used to find the covariant and contravariant components in
3523  ! Flux coordinates. These are then transformed to Cartesian coordinates and
3524  ! plotted.
3525  ! Note that vector plots for different Richardson levels can be combined to
3526  ! show the total grid by just plotting them all individually.
3527  ! Note: The metric factors and transformation matrices have to be allocated.
3528  integer function kappa_plot(grid_eq,eq_1,eq_2,rich_lvl) result(ierr)
3529  use grid_utilities, only: calc_vec_comp
3530  use eq_vars, only: eq_1_type, eq_2_type
3531  use eq_utilities, only: calc_inv_met
3532  use num_vars, only: eq_style, norm_disc_prec_eq, use_normalization
3533  use num_utilities, only: c
3534  use eq_vars, only: r_0
3535  use vmec_utilities, only: calc_trigon_factors
3536 #if ldebug
3537  use num_vars, only: ltest, eq_jobs_lims, eq_job_nr
3538  use input_utilities, only: get_log
3539  use grid_utilities, only: trim_grid, calc_xyz_grid
3540 #endif
3541 
3542  character(*), parameter :: rout_name = 'kappa_plot'
3543 
3544  ! input / output
3545  type(grid_type), intent(inout) :: grid_eq ! equilibrium grid
3546  type(eq_1_type), intent(in) :: eq_1 ! metric equilibrium variables
3547  type(eq_2_type), intent(in) :: eq_2 ! metric equilibrium variables
3548  integer, intent(in), optional :: rich_lvl ! Richardson level
3549 
3550  ! local variables
3551  real(dp), allocatable :: k_com(:,:,:,:,:) ! covariant and contravariant components of kappa (dim1,dim2,dim3,3,2)
3552  real(dp), allocatable :: k_mag(:,:,:) ! magnitude of kappa (dim1,dim2,dim3)
3553  character(len=15) :: base_name ! base name
3554 #if ldebug
3555  type(grid_type) :: grid_trim ! trimmed equilibrium grid
3556  integer :: id ! counter
3557  integer :: norm_id(2) ! untrimmed normal indices for trimmed grids
3558  integer :: plot_dim(4) ! dimensions of plot
3559  integer :: plot_offset(4) ! local offset of plot
3560  real(dp), allocatable :: XYZ(:,:,:,:,:) ! X, Y and Z of surface in cylindrical coordinates, trimmed grid
3561  real(dp), allocatable :: k_com_inv(:,:,:,:) ! inverted cartesian components of curvature
3562  logical, save :: asked_for_testing = .false. ! whether we have been asked to test
3563  logical, save :: testing = .false. ! whether we are testing
3564 #endif
3565 
3566  ! initialize ierr
3567  ierr = 0
3568 
3569  ! tests
3570  if (eq_style.eq.1 .and. .not.allocated(grid_eq%trigon_factors)) then
3571  ierr = 1
3572  chckerr('trigonometric factors not allocated')
3573  end if
3574 
3575  ! set up components and magnitude of kappa
3576  allocate(k_com(grid_eq%n(1),grid_eq%n(2),grid_eq%loc_n_r,3,2))
3577  allocate(k_mag(grid_eq%n(1),grid_eq%n(2),grid_eq%loc_n_r))
3578  k_com = 0._dp
3579  k_mag = 0._dp
3580 
3581  ! covariant components:
3582  ! kappa . e_alpha = kappa_g
3583  ! kappa . e_psi = kappa_n - kappa_g h12/h22
3584  ! kappa . e_theta = 0
3585  ! and similar for Q
3586  k_com(:,:,:,1,1) = eq_2%kappa_g
3587  k_com(:,:,:,2,1) = eq_2%kappa_n - &
3588  &eq_2%kappa_g * &
3589  &eq_2%h_FD(:,:,:,c([1,2],.true.),0,0,0)/&
3590  &eq_2%h_FD(:,:,:,c([2,2],.true.),0,0,0)
3591  k_com(:,:,:,3,1) = 0._dp
3592 
3593  ! contravariant components:
3594  ! kappa . nabla alpha = kappa_n h12 + kappa_g g33/(J^2 h22)
3595  ! kappa . nabla psi = kappa_n h22
3596  ! kappa . nabla theta = kappa_n h23 - kappa_g g13/(J^2 h22)
3597  ! and similar for Q
3598  k_com(:,:,:,1,2) = eq_2%kappa_n * &
3599  &eq_2%h_FD(:,:,:,c([1,2],.true.),0,0,0) + &
3600  &eq_2%kappa_g * &
3601  &eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([3,3],.true.),0,0,0) / &
3602  &(eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,0,0)**2*&
3603  &eq_2%h_FD(:,:,:,c([2,2],.true.),0,0,0))
3604  k_com(:,:,:,2,2) = eq_2%kappa_n * &
3605  &eq_2%h_FD(:,:,:,c([2,2],.true.),0,0,0)
3606  k_com(:,:,:,3,2) = eq_2%kappa_n * &
3607  &eq_2%h_FD(:,:,:,c([3,2],.true.),0,0,0) - &
3608  &eq_2%kappa_g * &
3609  &eq_2%g_FD(:,:,:,c([3,1],.true.),0,0,0) / &
3610  &(eq_2%jac_FD(:,:,:,0,0,0)**2*&
3611  &eq_2%h_FD(:,:,:,c([2,2],.true.),0,0,0))
3612 
3613  ! transform back to unnormalized quantity
3614  if (use_normalization) k_com = k_com / r_0
3615 
3616  ! set plot variables
3617  base_name = 'kappa'
3618  if (present(rich_lvl)) then
3619  if (rich_lvl.gt.0) base_name = trim(base_name)//'_R_'//&
3620  &trim(i2str(rich_lvl))
3621  end if
3622 
3623  ! transform coordinates
3624  ierr = calc_vec_comp(grid_eq,grid_eq,eq_1,eq_2,k_com,&
3625  &norm_disc_prec_eq,v_mag=k_mag,base_name=base_name)
3626  chckerr('')
3627 
3628 #if ldebug
3629  if (ltest) then
3630  if (.not.asked_for_testing) then
3631  call writo('Do you want to plot the inversion in kappa?')
3632  call lvl_ud(1)
3633  testing = get_log(.false.)
3634  asked_for_testing = .true.
3635  call lvl_ud(-1)
3636  end if
3637  if (testing) then
3638  call writo('Every point in the grid is transformed by &
3639  &displacing it in the direction of the curvature,')
3640  call writo('by a distance equal to the inverse of the &
3641  &curvature. I.e. the point is displaced to the center &
3642  &of curvature.')
3643  call lvl_ud(1)
3644 
3645  ! trim equilibrium grid
3646  ierr = trim_grid(grid_eq,grid_trim,norm_id)
3647  chckerr('')
3648 
3649  ! set up plot dimensions and local dimensions
3650  plot_dim = [grid_trim%n,3]
3651  plot_offset = [0,0,grid_trim%i_min-1,0]
3652 
3653  ! possibly modify if multiple equilibrium parallel jobs
3654  if (size(eq_jobs_lims,2).gt.1) then
3655  plot_dim(1) = eq_jobs_lims(2,size(eq_jobs_lims,2)) - &
3656  &eq_jobs_lims(1,1) + 1
3657  plot_offset(1) = eq_jobs_lims(1,eq_job_nr) - 1
3658  end if
3659 
3660  ! set up inverted cartesian components
3661  allocate(k_com_inv(grid_trim%n(1),grid_trim%n(2),&
3662  &grid_trim%loc_n_r,3))
3663  do id = 1,3
3664  k_com_inv(:,:,:,id) = &
3665  &k_com(:,:,norm_id(1):norm_id(2),id,1)/&
3666  &(k_mag(:,:,norm_id(1):norm_id(2))**2)
3667  end do
3668 
3669  ! if VMEC, calculate trigonometric factors of trimmed grid
3670  if (eq_style.eq.1) then
3671  ierr = calc_trigon_factors(grid_trim%theta_E,&
3672  &grid_trim%zeta_E,grid_trim%trigon_factors)
3673  chckerr('')
3674  end if
3675 
3676  ! calculate X, Y and Z
3677  allocate(xyz(grid_trim%n(1),grid_trim%n(2),grid_trim%loc_n_r,3,&
3678  &3))
3679  ierr = calc_xyz_grid(grid_eq,grid_trim,xyz(:,:,:,1,1),&
3680  &xyz(:,:,:,1,2),xyz(:,:,:,1,3))
3681  chckerr('')
3682 
3683  ! produce a plot of center of curvature for every point
3684  call plot_hdf5(['cen_of_curv'],'TEST_cen_of_curv_vec',&
3685  &k_com_inv,tot_dim=plot_dim,loc_offset=plot_offset,&
3686  &x=xyz(:,:,:,:,1),y=xyz(:,:,:,:,2),z=xyz(:,:,:,:,3),&
3687  &col=4,cont_plot=eq_job_nr.gt.1,&
3688  &description='center of curvature')
3689 
3690  ! displace the points to the center of curvature
3691  do id = 1,3
3692  xyz(:,:,:,1,id) = xyz(:,:,:,1,id) + k_com_inv(:,:,:,id)
3693  end do
3694  xyz(:,:,:,2,:) = xyz(:,:,:,1,:)
3695  xyz(:,:,:,3,:) = xyz(:,:,:,3,:)
3696 
3697  ! produce an inverted plot
3698  call plot_hdf5(['cen_of_curv_inv'],'TEST_cen_of_curv_inv_vec',&
3699  &-k_com_inv,tot_dim=plot_dim,loc_offset=plot_offset,&
3700  &x=xyz(:,:,:,:,1),y=xyz(:,:,:,:,2),z=xyz(:,:,:,:,3),&
3701  &col=4,cont_plot=eq_job_nr.gt.1,&
3702  &description='center of curvature')
3703 
3704  ! clean up
3705  call grid_trim%dealloc()
3706 
3707  call lvl_ud(-1)
3708  end if
3709  end if
3710 #endif
3711  end function kappa_plot
3712 
3713 
3714  ! Print equilibrium quantities to an output file:
3715  ! - flux: pres_FD, q_saf_FD, rot_t_FD, flux_p_FD, flux_t_FD, rho, S,
3716  ! kappa_n, kappa_g, sigma
3717  ! - metric: g_FD, h_FD, jac_FD
3718  ! If "rich_lvl" is provided, "_R_rich_lvl" is appended to the data name if
3719  ! it is > 0 (only for eq_2).
3720  ! Optionally, for eq_2, it can be specified that this is a divided parallel
3721  ! grid, corresponding to the variable "eq_jobs_lims" with index "eq_job_nr".
3722  ! In this case, the total grid size is adjusted to the one specified by
3723  ! "eq_jobs_lims" and the grid is written as a subset.
3724  ! Note: The equilibrium quantities are outputted in Flux coordinates.
3725  ! Note: The metric equilibrium quantities can be deallocated on the fly,
3726  ! which is useful if this routine is followed by a deallocation any way, so
3727  ! that memory usage does not almost double.
3728  ! Note: print_output_eq_2 is only used by HELENA now, as for VMEC it is too
3729  ! slow since there are often multiple VMEC equilibrium jobs, while for
3730  ! HELENA this is explicitely forbidden.
3731  integer function print_output_eq_1(grid_eq,eq,data_name) result(ierr) ! flux version
3732  use num_vars, only: pb3d_name
3733  use hdf5_ops, only: print_hdf5_arrs
3734  use hdf5_vars, only: dealloc_var_1d, var_1d_type, &
3735  &max_dim_var_1d
3736  use grid_utilities, only: trim_grid
3737 
3738  character(*), parameter :: rout_name = 'print_output_eq_1'
3739 
3740  ! input / output
3741  type(grid_type), intent(in) :: grid_eq ! equilibrium grid variables
3742  type(eq_1_type), intent(in) :: eq ! flux equilibrium variables
3743  character(len=*), intent(in) :: data_name ! name under which to store
3744 
3745  ! local variables
3746  integer :: norm_id(2) ! untrimmed normal indices for trimmed grids
3747  type(var_1d_type), allocatable, target :: eq_1D(:) ! 1D equivalent of eq. variables
3748  type(var_1d_type), pointer :: eq_1D_loc => null() ! local element in eq_1D
3749  type(grid_type) :: grid_trim ! trimmed grid
3750  integer :: id ! counter
3751  integer :: loc_size ! local size
3752 
3753  ! initialize ierr
3754  ierr = 0
3755 
3756  ! user output
3757  call writo('Write flux equilibrium variables to output file')
3758  call lvl_ud(1)
3759 
3760  ! trim grids
3761  ierr = trim_grid(grid_eq,grid_trim,norm_id)
3762  chckerr('')
3763 
3764  ! set up the 1D equivalents of the equilibrium variables
3765  allocate(eq_1d(max_dim_var_1d))
3766 
3767  ! Set up common variables eq_1D
3768  id = 1
3769 
3770  ! pres_FD
3771  eq_1d_loc => eq_1d(id); id = id+1
3772  eq_1d_loc%var_name = 'pres_FD'
3773  allocate(eq_1d_loc%tot_i_min(2),eq_1d_loc%tot_i_max(2))
3774  allocate(eq_1d_loc%loc_i_min(2),eq_1d_loc%loc_i_max(2))
3775  eq_1d_loc%tot_i_min = [1,0]
3776  eq_1d_loc%tot_i_max = [grid_trim%n(3),size(eq%pres_FD,2)-1]
3777  eq_1d_loc%loc_i_min = [grid_trim%i_min,0]
3778  eq_1d_loc%loc_i_max = [grid_trim%i_max,size(eq%pres_FD,2)-1]
3779  loc_size = size(eq%pres_FD(norm_id(1):norm_id(2),:))
3780  allocate(eq_1d_loc%p(loc_size))
3781  eq_1d_loc%p = reshape(eq%pres_FD(norm_id(1):norm_id(2),:),[loc_size])
3782 
3783  ! q_saf_FD
3784  eq_1d_loc => eq_1d(id); id = id+1
3785  eq_1d_loc%var_name = 'q_saf_FD'
3786  allocate(eq_1d_loc%tot_i_min(2),eq_1d_loc%tot_i_max(2))
3787  allocate(eq_1d_loc%loc_i_min(2),eq_1d_loc%loc_i_max(2))
3788  eq_1d_loc%tot_i_min = [1,0]
3789  eq_1d_loc%tot_i_max = [grid_trim%n(3),size(eq%q_saf_FD,2)-1]
3790  eq_1d_loc%loc_i_min = [grid_trim%i_min,0]
3791  eq_1d_loc%loc_i_max = [grid_trim%i_max,size(eq%q_saf_FD,2)-1]
3792  loc_size = size(eq%q_saf_FD(norm_id(1):norm_id(2),:))
3793  allocate(eq_1d_loc%p(loc_size))
3794  eq_1d_loc%p = reshape(eq%q_saf_FD(norm_id(1):norm_id(2),:),[loc_size])
3795 
3796  ! rot_t_FD
3797  eq_1d_loc => eq_1d(id); id = id+1
3798  eq_1d_loc%var_name = 'rot_t_FD'
3799  allocate(eq_1d_loc%tot_i_min(2),eq_1d_loc%tot_i_max(2))
3800  allocate(eq_1d_loc%loc_i_min(2),eq_1d_loc%loc_i_max(2))
3801  eq_1d_loc%tot_i_min = [1,0]
3802  eq_1d_loc%tot_i_max = [grid_trim%n(3),size(eq%rot_t_FD,2)-1]
3803  eq_1d_loc%loc_i_min = [grid_trim%i_min,0]
3804  eq_1d_loc%loc_i_max = [grid_trim%i_max,size(eq%rot_t_FD,2)-1]
3805  loc_size = size(eq%rot_t_FD(norm_id(1):norm_id(2),:))
3806  allocate(eq_1d_loc%p(loc_size))
3807  eq_1d_loc%p = reshape(eq%rot_t_FD(norm_id(1):norm_id(2),:),[loc_size])
3808 
3809  ! flux_p_FD
3810  eq_1d_loc => eq_1d(id); id = id+1
3811  eq_1d_loc%var_name = 'flux_p_FD'
3812  allocate(eq_1d_loc%tot_i_min(2),eq_1d_loc%tot_i_max(2))
3813  allocate(eq_1d_loc%loc_i_min(2),eq_1d_loc%loc_i_max(2))
3814  eq_1d_loc%tot_i_min = [1,0]
3815  eq_1d_loc%tot_i_max = [grid_trim%n(3),size(eq%flux_p_FD,2)-1]
3816  eq_1d_loc%loc_i_min = [grid_trim%i_min,0]
3817  eq_1d_loc%loc_i_max = [grid_trim%i_max,size(eq%flux_p_FD,2)-1]
3818  loc_size = size(eq%flux_p_FD(norm_id(1):norm_id(2),:))
3819  allocate(eq_1d_loc%p(loc_size))

4050  ! Redistribute the equilibrium variables, but only the Flux variables are
4051  ! saved. See "redistribute_output_grid" for more information.
4052  integer function redistribute_output_eq_1(grid,grid_out,eq,eq_out) &
4053  &result(ierr) ! flux version
4054  use mpi_utilities, only: redistribute_var
4055 
4056  character(*), parameter :: rout_name = 'redistribute_output_eq_1'
4057 
4058  ! input / output
4059  type(grid_type), intent(in) :: grid ! equilibrium grid variables
4060  type(grid_type), intent(in) :: grid_out ! redistributed equilibrium grid variables
4061  type(eq_1_type), intent(inout) :: eq ! flux equilibrium variables
4062  type(eq_1_type), intent(inout) :: eq_out ! flux equilibrium variables in redistributed grid
4063 
4064  ! local variables
4065  integer :: id ! counter
4066 
4067  ! initialize ierr
4068  ierr = 0
4069 
4070  ! user output
4071  call writo('Redistribute flux equilibrium variables')
4072  call lvl_ud(1)
4073 
4074  ! create redistributed flux equilibrium variables
4075  call eq_out%init(grid_out,setup_e=.false.,setup_f=.true.)
4076 
4077  ! for all derivatives
4078  do id = 0,max_deriv
4079  ! pres_FD
4080  ierr = redistribute_var(eq%pres_FD(:,id),eq_out%pres_FD(:,id),&
4081  &[grid%i_min,grid%i_max],[grid_out%i_min,grid_out%i_max])
4082  chckerr('')
4083 
4084  ! q_saf_FD
4085  ierr = redistribute_var(eq%q_saf_FD(:,id),eq_out%q_saf_FD(:,id),&
4086  &[grid%i_min,grid%i_max],[grid_out%i_min,grid_out%i_max])
4087  chckerr('')
4088 
4089  ! rot_t_FD
4090  ierr = redistribute_var(eq%rot_t_FD(:,id),eq_out%rot_t_FD(:,id),&
4091  &[grid%i_min,grid%i_max],[grid_out%i_min,grid_out%i_max])
4092  chckerr('')
4093 
4094  ! flux_p_FD
4095  ierr = redistribute_var(eq%flux_p_FD(:,id),eq_out%flux_p_FD(:,id),&
4096  &[grid%i_min,grid%i_max],[grid_out%i_min,grid_out%i_max])
4097  chckerr('')
4098 
4099  ! flux_t_FD
4100  ierr = redistribute_var(eq%flux_t_FD(:,id),eq_out%flux_t_FD(:,id),&
4101  &[grid%i_min,grid%i_max],[grid_out%i_min,grid_out%i_max])
4102  chckerr('')
4103  end do
4104 
4105  ! rho
4106  ierr = redistribute_var(eq%rho,eq_out%rho,&

4113  integer function redistribute_output_eq_2(grid,grid_out,eq,eq_out) &
4114  &result(ierr) ! metric version
4115  use mpi_utilities, only: redistribute_var
4116 
4117  character(*), parameter :: rout_name = 'redistribute_output_eq_2'
4118 
4119  ! input / output
4120  type(grid_type), intent(in) :: grid ! equilibrium grid variables
4121  type(grid_type), intent(in) :: grid_out ! redistributed equilibrium grid variables
4122  type(eq_2_type), intent(inout) :: eq ! metric equilibrium variables
4123  type(eq_2_type), intent(inout) :: eq_out ! metric equilibrium variables in redistributed grid
4124 
4125  ! local variables
4126  integer :: id, jd, kd, ld ! counters
4127  integer :: lims(2), lims_dis(2) ! limits and distributed limits, taking into account the angular extent
4128  integer :: siz(3), siz_dis(3) ! size for geometric part of variable
4129  real(dp), allocatable :: temp_var(:) ! temporary variable
4130 
4131  ! initialize ierr
4132  ierr = 0
4133 
4134  ! user output
4135  call writo('Redistribute metric equilibrium variables')
4136  call lvl_ud(1)
4137 
4138  ! create redistributed metric equilibrium variables
4139  call eq_out%init(grid_out,setup_e=.false.,setup_f=.true.)
4140 
4141  ! set up limits taking into account angular extent and temporary var
4142  lims(1) = product(grid%n(1:2))*(grid%i_min-1)+1
4143  lims(2) = product(grid%n(1:2))*grid%i_max
4144  lims_dis(1) = product(grid%n(1:2))*(grid_out%i_min-1)+1
4145  lims_dis(2) = product(grid%n(1:2))*grid_out%i_max
4146  siz = [grid%n(1:2),grid%loc_n_r]
4147  siz_dis = [grid_out%n(1:2),grid_out%loc_n_r]
4148  allocate(temp_var(product(siz_dis)))
4149 
4150  ! for all derivatives and metric factors
4151  do jd = 0,max_deriv
4152  do kd = 0,max_deriv
4153  do ld = 0,max_deriv
4154  do id = 1,size(eq%g_FD,4)
4155  ! g_FD
4156  ierr = redistribute_var(reshape(&
4157  &eq%g_FD(:,:,:,id,jd,kd,ld),[product(siz)]),&
4158  &temp_var,lims,lims_dis)
4159  chckerr('')
4160  eq_out%g_FD(:,:,:,id,jd,kd,ld) = &
4161  &reshape(temp_var,siz_dis)
4162 
4163  ! h_FD
4164  ierr = redistribute_var(reshape(&
4165  &eq%h_FD(:,:,:,id,jd,kd,ld),[product(siz)]),&
4166  &temp_var,lims,lims_dis)
4167  chckerr('')
4168  eq_out%h_FD(:,:,:,id,jd,kd,ld) = &
4169  &reshape(temp_var,siz_dis)
4170  end do
4171  ! jac_FD
4172  ierr = redistribute_var(reshape(&
4173  &eq%jac_FD(:,:,:,jd,kd,ld),[product(siz)]),&
4174  &temp_var,lims,lims_dis)
4175  chckerr('')
4176  eq_out%jac_FD(:,:,:,jd,kd,ld) = &
4177  &reshape(temp_var,siz_dis)
4178  end do
4179  end do
4180  end do
4181 
4182  ! S
4183  ierr = redistribute_var(reshape(eq%S,[product(siz)]),temp_var,&
4184  &lims,lims_dis)
4185  chckerr('')
4186  eq_out%S = reshape(temp_var,siz_dis)
4187 
4188  ! kappa_n
4189  ierr = redistribute_var(reshape(eq%kappa_n,[product(siz)]),temp_var,&
4190  &lims,lims_dis)
4191  chckerr('')
4192  eq_out%kappa_n = reshape(temp_var,siz_dis)
4193 
4194  ! kappa_g
4195  ierr = redistribute_var(reshape(eq%kappa_g,[product(siz)]),temp_var,&
4196  &lims,lims_dis)
4197  chckerr('')
4198  eq_out%kappa_g = reshape(temp_var,siz_dis)
4199 
4200  ! sigma
4201  ierr = redistribute_var(reshape(eq%sigma,[product(siz)]),temp_var,&
4202  &lims,lims_dis)
4203  chckerr('')
4204  eq_out%sigma = reshape(temp_var,siz_dis)
4205 
4206  ! user output
4207  call lvl_ud(-1)
4208  end function redistribute_output_eq_2
4209 
4210  ! Divides the equilibrium jobs.
4211  ! For PB3D, the entire parallel range has to be calculated, but due to
4212  ! memory limits this has to be split up in pieces. Every piece has to be
4213  ! able to contain the equilibrium variables (see note below), as well as the
4214  ! vectorial perturbation variables. These are later combined into tensorial
4215  ! variables and integrated.
4216  ! The equilibrium variables have to be operated on to calculate them, which
4217  ! translates to a scale factor "mem_scale_fac". However, in the perturbation
4218  ! phase, when they are just used, this scale factor is not needed.
4219  ! In its most extreme form, the division in equilibrium jobs would be the
4220  ! individual calculation on a fundamental integration integral of the
4221  ! parallel points:
4222  ! - for magn_int_style = 1 (trapezoidal), this is 1 point,
4223  ! - for magn_int_style = 2 (Simpson 3/8), this is 3 points.
4224  ! For HELENA, the parallel derivatives are calculated discretely, the
4225  ! equilibrium and vectorial perturbation variables are tabulated first in
4226  ! this HELENA grid. This happens in the first Richardson level. In all
4227  ! Richardson levels, afterwards, these variables are interpolated in the
4228  ! angular directions. In this case, therefore, there can be no division of
4229  ! this HELENA output interval for the first Richardson level.
4230  ! This procedure does the job of dividing the grids setting the global
4231  ! variables 'eq_jobs_lims'.
4232  ! The integration of the tensorial perturbation variables is adjusted:
4233  ! - If the first job of the parallel jobs and not the first Richardson
4234  ! level: add half of the integrated tensorial perturbation quantities of
4235  ! the previous level.
4236  ! - If not the first job of the parallel jobs, add the integrated
4237  ! tensorial perturbation quantities to those of the previous parallel job,
4238  ! same Richardson level.
4239  ! In fact, the equilibrium jobs have much in common with the Richardson
4240  ! levels, as is attested by the existence of the routines "do_eq" and
4241  ! "eq_info", which are equivalent to "do_rich" and "rich_info".
4242  ! In POST, finally, the situation is slightly different for HELENA, as all
4243  ! the requested variables have to fit, including the interpolated variables,
4244  ! as they are stored whereas in PB3D they are not. The parallel range to be
4245  ! taken is then the one of the output grid, including a base range for the
4246  ! variables tabulated on the HELENA grid. Also, for extended output grids,
4247  ! the size of the grid in the secondary angle has to be included in n_par_X
4248  ! (i.e. toroidal when poloidal flux is used and vice versa). Furthermore,
4249  ! multiple equilibrium jobs are allowed.
4250  ! To this end, optionally, a base number can be provided for n_par_X, that
4251  ! is always added to the number of points in the divided n_par_X.
4252  ! Note: For PB3D, only the variables g_FD, h_FD and jac_FD are counted, as
4253  ! the equilibrium variables and the transformation matrices are deleted
4254  ! after use. Also, S, sigma, kappa_n and kappa_g can be neglected as they do
4255  ! not contain derivatives and are therefore much smaller. in both
4256  ! "calc_memory" routines, however, a 50% safety factor is used to account
4257  ! for this somewhat.
4258  integer function divide_eq_jobs(n_par_X,arr_size,n_div,n_div_max,&
4259  &n_par_X_base,range_name) result(ierr)
4260 
4261  use num_vars, only: max_tot_mem, max_x_mem, magn_int_style, &
4262  &mem_scale_fac, prog_style
4263  use rich_vars, only: rich_lvl
4264  use eq_utilities, only: calc_memory_eq
4265  use x_utilities, only: calc_memory_x
4266  use x_vars, only: n_mod_x
4267 
4268  character(*), parameter :: rout_name = 'divide_eq_jobs'
4269 
4270  ! input / output
4271  integer, intent(in) :: n_par_X ! number of parallel points to be divided
4272  integer, intent(in) :: arr_size(2) ! array size (using loc_n_r) for eq_2 and X_1 variables
4273  integer, intent(inout) :: n_div ! final number of divisions
4274  integer, intent(in), optional :: n_div_max ! maximum n_div
4275  integer, intent(in), optional :: n_par_X_base ! base n_par_X, undivisible
4276  character(len=*), intent(in), optional :: range_name ! name of range
4277 
4278  ! local variables
4279  real(dp) :: mem_size(2) ! approximation of memory required for eq_2 and X_1 variables
4280  integer :: n_par_X_base_loc ! local n_par_X_base
4281  integer :: max_mem_req ! maximum memory required
4282  integer :: n_div_max_loc ! maximum n_div
4283  integer :: n_par_range ! nr. of points in range
4284  character(len=max_str_ln) :: range_message ! message about how many ranges
4285  character(len=max_str_ln) :: err_msg ! error message
4286  character(len=max_str_ln) :: range_name_loc ! local range name
4287 
4288  ! initialize ierr
4289  ierr = 0
4290 
4291  ! user output
4292  call writo('Dividing the equilibrium jobs')
4293  call lvl_ud(1)
4294 
4295  ! set up width of fundamental interval
4296  select case (magn_int_style)
4297  case (1) ! Trapezoidal rule
4298  fund_n_par = 1
4299  case (2) ! Simpson's 3/8 rule
4300  fund_n_par = 3
4301  end select
4302 
4303  ! set up local n_par_X_base
4304  n_par_x_base_loc = 0
4305  if (present(n_par_x_base)) n_par_x_base_loc = n_par_x_base
4306 
4307  ! set up local range name
4308  range_name_loc = 'parallel points'
4309  if (present(range_name)) range_name_loc = trim(range_name)
4310 
4311  ! setup auxilliary variables
4312  n_div = 0
4313  mem_size = huge(1._dp)
4314  if (rich_lvl.eq.1) then
4315  n_div_max_loc = (n_par_x-1)/fund_n_par
4316  else
4317  n_div_max_loc = n_par_x/fund_n_par
4318  end if
4319  if (present(n_div_max)) n_div_max_loc = n_div_max
4320  n_div_max_loc = max(1,n_div_max_loc) ! cannot have less than 1 piece
4321 
4322  ! calculate largest possible range of parallel points fitting in memory
4323  do while (max_tot_mem.lt.sum(mem_size)) ! combined mem_size has to be smaller than total memory
4324  n_div = n_div + 1
4325  n_par_range = ceiling(n_par_x*1._dp/n_div + n_par_x_base_loc)
4326  ierr = calc_memory_eq(arr_size(1),n_par_range,mem_size(1))
4327  chckerr('')
4328  mem_size(1) = mem_size(1)*mem_scale_fac ! operations have to be done on eq, it is not just stored.
4329  ierr = calc_memory_x(1,arr_size(2)*n_par_range,n_mod_x,mem_size(2)) ! all modes have to be stored
4330  chckerr('')
4331  if (n_div.gt.n_div_max_loc) then ! still not enough memory
4332  ierr = 1
4333  err_msg = 'The memory limit is too low, need more than '//&
4334  &trim(i2str(max_mem_req))//'MB'
4335  chckerr(err_msg)
4336  end if
4337  max_mem_req = ceiling(sum(mem_size))
4338  end do
4339  if (n_div.gt.1) then
4340  range_message = 'The '//trim(i2str(n_par_x))//' '//&
4341  &trim(range_name_loc)//' are split into '//&
4342  &trim(i2str(n_div))//' and '//trim(i2str(n_div))//&
4343  &' collective jobs are done serially'
4344  else
4345  range_message = 'The '//trim(i2str(n_par_x))//' '//&
4346  &trim(range_name_loc)//' can be done without splitting them'
4347  end if
4348  call writo(range_message)
4349  call writo('The total memory for all processes together is estimated &
4350  &to be about '//trim(i2str(ceiling(sum(mem_size))))//'MB')
4351  call lvl_ud(1)
4352  call writo('(maximum: '//trim(i2str(ceiling(max_tot_mem)))//'&
4353  &MB, user specified)')
4354  call lvl_ud(-1)
4355 
4356  if (prog_style.eq.1) then
4357  ! calculate max memory available for perturbation calculations
4358  mem_size(1) = mem_size(1)/mem_scale_fac ! rescale by mem_scale_fac as eq is now just stored
4359  max_x_mem = max_tot_mem - sum(mem_size)
4360  call writo('In the perturbation phase, the equilibrium variables &
4361  &are not being operated on:')
4362  call lvl_ud(1)
4363  call writo('This translates to a scale factor 1/'//&
4364  &trim(r2strt(mem_scale_fac)))
4365  call writo('Therefore, the memory left for the perturbation phase &
4366  &is '//trim(i2str(ceiling(max_x_mem)))//'MB')
4367  call lvl_ud(-1)
4368  end if
4369 
4370  ! user output
4371  call lvl_ud(-1)
4372  call writo('Equilibrium jobs divided')
4373  end function divide_eq_jobs
4374 
4375  ! Calculate eq_jobs_lims.
4376  ! Take into account that every job has to start and end at the start and end
4377  ! of a fundamental integration interval, as discussed in above:
4378  ! - for magn_int_style = 1 (trapezoidal), this is 1 point,
4379  ! - for magn_int_style = 2 (Simpson 3/8), this is 3 points.
4380  ! for POST, there are no Richardson levels, and there has to be overlap of
4381  ! one always, in order to have correct composite integrals of the different
4382  ! regions.
4383  integer function calc_eq_jobs_lims(n_par_X,n_div) result(ierr)
4384  use num_vars, only: prog_style, eq_jobs_lims, eq_job_nr
4385  use rich_vars, only: rich_lvl
4386 
4387  character(*), parameter :: rout_name = 'calc_eq_jobs_lims'
4388 
4389  ! input / output
4390  integer, intent(in) :: n_par_X ! number of parallel points in this Richardson level
4391  integer, intent(in) :: n_div ! nr. of divisions of parallel ranges
4392 
4393  ! local variables
4394  integer :: id ! counter
4395  integer :: ol_width ! overlap width
4396  integer, allocatable :: n_par(:) ! number of points per range
4397  character(len=max_str_ln) :: err_msg ! error message
4398 
4399  ! initialize ierr
4400  ierr = 0
4401 
4402  ! Also initialize eq_job_nr to 0 as it is incremented by "do_eq".
4403  eq_job_nr = 0
4404 
4405  allocate(n_par(n_div))
4406  n_par = n_par_x/n_div ! number of parallel points on this processor
4407  n_par(1:mod(n_par_x,n_div)) = n_par(1:mod(n_par_x,n_div)) + 1 ! add a point to if there is a remainder
4408  chckerr('')
4409 
4410  ! (re)allocate equilibrium jobs limits
4411  if (allocated(eq_jobs_lims)) deallocate(eq_jobs_lims)
4412  allocate(eq_jobs_lims(2,n_div))
4413 
4414  ! set overlap width
4415  select case (prog_style)
4416  case (1) ! PB3D
4417  if (rich_lvl.eq.1) then
4418  ol_width = 1
4419  else
4420  ol_width = 0
4421  end if
4422  case (2) ! POST
4423  ol_width = 1
4424  end select
4425 
4426  ! loop over divisions
4427  do id = 1,n_div
4428  ! setup first guess, without taking into account fundamental
4429  ! integration intervals
4430  if (id.eq.1) then
4431  eq_jobs_lims(1,id) = 1
4432  else
4433  eq_jobs_lims(1,id) = eq_jobs_lims(2,id-1) + 1 - ol_width
4434  end if
4435  eq_jobs_lims(2,id) = sum(n_par(1:id))
4436 
4437  ! take into account fundamental interval
4438  if (n_div.gt.1) then
4439  eq_jobs_lims(2,id) = eq_jobs_lims(1,id) - 1 + ol_width + &
4440  &fund_n_par * max(1,nint(&
4441  &(eq_jobs_lims(2,id)-eq_jobs_lims(1,id)+1._dp-ol_width)/&
4442  &fund_n_par))
4443  end if
4444  end do
4445 
4446  ! test whether end coincides with sum of n_par
4447  if (eq_jobs_lims(2,n_div).ne.sum(n_par)) then
4448  ierr = 1
4449  err_msg = 'Limits don''t match, try with more memory or lower &
4450  &magn_int_style'
4451  chckerr(err_msg)
4452  end if
4453  end function calc_eq_jobs_lims
4454 
4455 #if ldebug
4456  ! See if T_EF it complies with the theory of [ADD REF]
4457  integer function test_t_ef(grid_eq,eq_1,eq_2) result(ierr)
4458  use num_vars, only: use_pol_flux_f, eq_style
4459  use grid_utilities, only: trim_grid
4460  use num_utilities, only: c
4461  use output_ops, only: plot_diff_hdf5
4462 
4463  character(*), parameter :: rout_name = 'test_T_EF'
4464 
4465  ! input / output
4466  type(grid_type), intent(in) :: grid_eq ! equilibrium grid
4467  type(eq_1_type), intent(in) :: eq_1 ! flux equilibrium
4468  type(eq_2_type), intent(in) :: eq_2 ! metric equilibrium
4469 
4470  ! local variables
4471  integer :: id, kd ! counter
4472  integer :: norm_id(2) ! untrimmed normal indices for trimmed grids
4473  real(dp), allocatable :: res(:,:,:,:) ! calculated result
4474  character(len=max_str_ln) :: file_name ! name of plot file
4475  character(len=max_str_ln) :: description ! description of plot
4476  integer :: tot_dim(3), loc_offset(3) ! total dimensions and local offset
4477  type(grid_type) :: grid_trim ! trimmed equilibrium grid
4478 
4479  ! initialize ierr
4480  ierr = 0
4481 
4482  ! output
4483  call writo('Going to test whether T_EF complies with the theory')
4484  call lvl_ud(1)
4485 
4486  ! trim extended grid into plot grid
4487  ierr = trim_grid(grid_eq,grid_trim,norm_id)
4488  chckerr('')
4489 
4490  ! set total and local dimensions and local offset
4491  tot_dim = [grid_trim%n(1),grid_trim%n(2),grid_trim%n(3)]
4492  loc_offset = [0,0,grid_trim%i_min-1]
4493 
4494  ! set up res
4495  allocate(res(grid_trim%n(1),grid_trim%n(2),grid_trim%loc_n_r,9))
4496  res = 0.0_dp
4497 
4498  ! calc res, depending on flux used in F coordinates and on which
4499  ! equilibrium style is being used:
4500  ! 1: VMEC
4501  ! 2: HELENA
4502  select case (eq_style)
4503  case (1) ! VMEC
4504  if (use_pol_flux_f) then ! using poloidal flux
4505  ! calculate T_EF(1,1)
4506  do kd = norm_id(1),norm_id(2)
4507  res(:,:,kd-norm_id(1)+1,1) = &
4508  &grid_eq%theta_F(:,:,kd)*eq_1%q_saf_E(kd,1) + &
4509  &eq_2%L_E(:,:,kd,1,0,0)*eq_1%q_saf_E(kd,0)
4510  end do
4511  ! calculate T_EF(2,1)
4512  do kd = norm_id(1),norm_id(2)
4513  res(:,:,kd-norm_id(1)+1,2) = &
4514  &(1._dp + eq_2%L_E(:,:,kd,0,1,0))*eq_1%q_saf_E(kd,0)
4515  end do
4516  ! calculate T_EF(3,1)
4517  do kd = norm_id(1),norm_id(2)
4518  res(:,:,kd-norm_id(1)+1,3) = -1._dp + &
4519  &eq_2%L_E(:,:,kd,0,0,1)*eq_1%q_saf_E(kd,0)
4520  end do
4521  ! calculate T_EF(1,2)
4522  do kd = norm_id(1),norm_id(2)
4523  res(:,:,kd-norm_id(1)+1,4) = eq_1%flux_p_E(kd,1)/(2*pi)
4524  end do
4525  ! calculate T_EF(1,3)
4526  res(:,:,:,7) = eq_2%L_E(:,:,norm_id(1):norm_id(2),1,0,0)
4527  ! calculate T_EF(2,3)
4528  res(:,:,:,8) = 1._dp + &
4529  &eq_2%L_E(:,:,norm_id(1):norm_id(2),0,1,0)
4530  ! calculate T_EF(3,3)
4531  res(:,:,:,9) = eq_2%L_E(:,:,norm_id(1):norm_id(2),0,0,1)
4532  else ! using toroidal flux
4533  ! calculate T_EF(1,1)
4534  do kd = norm_id(1),norm_id(2)
4535  res(:,:,kd-norm_id(1)+1,1) = - eq_2%L_E(:,:,kd,1,0,0) &
4536  &+ grid_eq%zeta_E(:,:,kd)*eq_1%rot_t_E(kd,1)
4537  end do
4538  ! calculate T_EF(2,1)
4539  res(:,:,:,2) = &
4540  &- (1._dp + eq_2%L_E(:,:,norm_id(1):norm_id(2),0,1,0))
4541  ! calculate T_EF(3,1)
4542  do kd = norm_id(1),norm_id(2)
4543  res(:,:,kd-norm_id(1)+1,3) = &
4544  &eq_1%rot_t_E(kd,0) - eq_2%L_E(:,:,kd,0,0,1)
4545  end do
4546  ! calculate T_EF(1,2)
4547  do kd = norm_id(1),norm_id(2)
4548  res(:,:,kd-norm_id(1)+1,4) = &
4549  &- eq_1%flux_t_E(kd,1)/(2*pi)
4550  end do
4551  ! calculate T_EF(3,3)
4552  res(:,:,:,9) = -1._dp
4553  end if
4554  case (2) ! HELENA
4555  if (use_pol_flux_f) then ! using poloidal flux
4556  ! calculate T_EF(1,1)
4557  do kd = norm_id(1),norm_id(2)
4558  res(:,:,kd-norm_id(1)+1,1) = &
4559  &- eq_1%q_saf_E(kd,1)*grid_eq%theta_E(:,:,kd)
4560  end do
4561  ! calculate T_EF(2,1)
4562  do kd = norm_id(1),norm_id(2)
4563  res(:,:,kd-norm_id(1)+1,2) = - eq_1%q_saf_E(kd,0)
4564  end do
4565  ! calculate T_EF(3,1)
4566  res(:,:,:,3) = 1._dp
4567  ! calculate T_EF(1,2)
4568  do kd = norm_id(1),norm_id(2)
4569  res(:,:,kd-norm_id(1)+1,4) = eq_1%flux_p_E(kd,1)/(2*pi)
4570  end do
4571  ! calculate T_EF(2,3)
4572  res(:,:,:,8) = 1._dp
4573  else ! using toroidal flux
4574  ! calculate T_EF(1,1)
4575  do kd = norm_id(1),norm_id(2)
4576  res(:,:,kd-norm_id(1)+1,1) = &
4577  &eq_1%rot_t_E(kd,1)*grid_eq%zeta_E(:,:,kd)
4578  end do
4579  ! calculate T_EF(2,1)
4580  res(:,:,:,2) = -1._dp
4581  ! calculate T_EF(3,1)
4582  do kd = norm_id(1),norm_id(2)
4583  res(:,:,kd-norm_id(1)+1,3) = eq_1%rot_t_E(kd,0)
4584  end do
4585  ! calculate T_EF(1,2)
4586  do kd = norm_id(1),norm_id(2)
4587  res(:,:,kd-norm_id(1)+1,4) = eq_1%flux_t_E(kd,1)/(2*pi)
4588  end do
4589  ! calculate T_EF(3,3)
4590  res(:,:,:,9) = 1._dp
4591  end if
4592  end select
4593 
4594  ! set up plot variables for calculated values
4595  do id = 1,3
4596  do kd = 1,3
4597  ! user output
4598  call writo('Testing T_EF('//trim(i2str(kd))//','//&
4599  &trim(i2str(id))//')')
4600  call lvl_ud(1)
4601 
4602  ! set some variables
4603  file_name = 'TEST_T_EF_'//trim(i2str(kd))//'_'//trim(i2str(id))
4604  description = 'Testing calculated with given value for T_EF('//&
4605  &trim(i2str(kd))//','//trim(i2str(id))//')'
4606 
4607  ! plot difference
4608  call plot_diff_hdf5(res(:,:,:,c([kd,id],.false.)),&
4609  &eq_2%T_EF(:,:,norm_id(1):norm_id(2),c([kd,id],.false.),&
4610  &0,0,0),file_name,tot_dim,loc_offset,description,&
4611  &output_message=.true.)
4612 
4613  call lvl_ud(-1)
4614  end do
4615  end do
4616 
4617  ! clean up
4618  call grid_trim%dealloc()
4619 
4620  ! user output
4621  call lvl_ud(-1)
4622  call writo('Test complete')
4623  end function test_t_ef

4625  ! Tests whether D1 D2 h_H is calculated correctly

4633  ! input / output

4682  &trim(i2str(id))//')')

4687  &trim(i2str(id))

4689  &//trim(i2str(kd))//','//trim(i2str(id))//')'
4690

4692  call plot_diff_hdf5(res(:,:,:,c([kd,id],.true.)),&
4693  &eq%h_E(:,:,norm_id(1):norm_id(2),&
4694  &c([kd,id],.true.),1,1,0),file_name,tot_dim,loc_offset,&
4695  &description,output_message=.true.)
4696

4700
